metadata.title: CVE-2015-8124 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Session fixation vulnerability in the "Remember Me" login feature inSymfony 2.3.x before 2.3.35, 2.6.x before 2.6.12, and 2.7.x before 2.7.7allows remote attackers to hijack web sessions via a session id.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.6+dfsg-1
php-symfony-asset - 3.4.6+dfsg-1
php-symfony-browser-kit - 3.4.6+dfsg-1
php-symfony-cache - 3.4.6+dfsg-1
php-symfony-class-loader - 3.4.6+dfsg-1

criterions.comment: symfony package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.6+dfsg-1').
